medical_history.chief_complaint: Back pain and a lesion in the lumbar spine.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until approximately 6 months before admission when low back pain developed and worsened, not relieved by ibuprofen. About 6 weeks before admission, severe pain radiating down her left leg to the ankle began. Her symptoms included excruciating back pain, particularly at night, associated with swelling and numbness in the knee and distal leg. Pain medications offered minimal relief, with worsening condition observed upon visiting various healthcare providers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of transient lumbar back pain after motor vehicle accidents. Migraine headaches. Allergic to penicillin.
medical_history.family_history: Parents living; some relatives had high blood pressure and hypercholesterolemia.
medical_history.social_history: Moved to the United States from the Caribbean as an infant, lived in an urban area with her boyfriend and child, worked in retail. No history of smoking tobacco, alcohol consumption, or illicit drug use.
